title: PRESS DIGEST - Bulgaria - Oct 30
text:
SOFIA, Oct 30 (Reuters) - These are some of the main stories in Bulgarian newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- The ruling centre-right GERB party has won the mayoral elections in eight out of 27 regional cities on Oct 27 and its candidates are the leading contenders in another 12 in the run-offs on Nov 3, results of the first round of the local vote showed. (24 Chasa, Trud)

TRUD - The ruling GERB party has secured 27 seats in the 61-member local parliament in Sofia, where it can form a majority with its coalition partner, nationalist VMRO party that will have 4 seats.

-- Over 100 fire fighters are battling a major fire that has spread on over 4,000 hectares engulfing dry grass and shrubs in a mountain range close to the border with Serbia. Serbian fire fighters are battling the blaze on their side. (24 Chasa, Monitor)

-- Business sentiment in industry, construction and trade worsened in October compared to a month earlier, statistics office data showed, mainly due to fears for a slowdown in exports and uncertainty over economic developments. (24 Chasa, Trud, Monitor)

CAPITAL - The EU insurance watchdog EIOPA has given its nod for Bulgaria to enter the euro zone's "waiting room" in a letter to the EU's executive Commission, leaving the European Central Bank as the last EU institution that should have its say whether Sofia should to join the ERM-2 mechanism.
